How can I use the `getlocalsolps` command in Verus?

You can use the `getlocalsolps` command in Verus by running the following command in the terminal:

```
> verus getlocalsolps
```

Alternatively, you can also use the command with the Verus JSON-RPC API by sending a request to `http://127.0.0.1:27486/` with the following JSON payload:

```
{
  "jsonrpc": "1.0",
  "id": "curltest",
  "method": "getlocalsolps",
  "params": []
}
```

You can do this using the `curl` command:

```
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getlocalsolps", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
